channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: When Search Meets Recommendation: Learning Disentangled Search Representation for Recommendation
item.description: In our paper, we propose a Search-Enhanced framework for the Sequential Recommendation (SESRec) that leverages users' search interests for recommendation, by disentangling similar and dissimilar representations within S&R behaviors.

item.title: On the Off-Target Problem of Zero-Shot Multilingual Neural Machine Translation
item.description: We conduct experiments on a multilingual machine translation benchmark in 11 languages.

item.title: FunASR: A Fundamental End-to-End Speech Recognition Toolkit
item.description: FunASR offers models trained on large-scale industrial corpora and the ability to deploy them in applications.

item.title: TrueTeacher: Learning Factual Consistency Evaluation with Large Language Models
item.description: Using the the mFACE dataset, we also show that our method generalizes to multilingual scenarios.

item.title: Scribble-Supervised Target Extraction Method Based on Inner Structure-Constraint for Remote Sensing Images
item.description: Weakly supervised learning based on scribble annotations in target extraction of remote sensing images has drawn much interest due to scribbles' flexibility in denoting winding objects and low cost of manually labeling.

item.title: Revisiting Long-term Time Series Forecasting: An Investigation on Linear Mapping
item.description: In this paper, we thoroughly investigate the intrinsic effectiveness of recent approaches and make three key observations: 1) linear mapping is critical to prior long-term time series forecasting efforts; 2) RevIN (reversible normalization) and CI (Channel Independent) play a vital role in improving overall forecasting performance; and 3) linear mapping can effectively capture periodic features in time series and has robustness for different periods across channels when increasing the input horizon.

item.title: Segment Any Anomaly without Training via Hybrid Prompt Regularization
item.description: We present a novel framework, i. e., Segment Any Anomaly + (SAA+), for zero-shot anomaly segmentation with hybrid prompt regularization to improve the adaptability of modern foundation models.

item.title: DiffUTE: Universal Text Editing Diffusion Model
item.description: Specifically, we build our model on a diffusion model and carefully modify the network structure to enable the model for drawing multilingual characters with the help of glyph and position information.

item.title: Take a Break in the Middle: Investigating Subgoals towards Hierarchical Script Generation
item.description: Goal-oriented Script Generation is a new task of generating a list of steps that can fulfill the given goal.

item.title: QPGesture: Quantization-Based and Phase-Guided Motion Matching for Natural Speech-Driven Gesture Generation
item.description: Levenshtein distance based on audio quantization as a similarity metric of corresponding speech of gestures helps match more appropriate gestures with speech, and solves the alignment problem of speech and gestures well.

item.title: SpeechGPT: Empowering Large Language Models with Intrinsic Cross-Modal Conversational Abilities
item.description: Multi-modal large language models are regarded as a crucial step towards Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) and have garnered significant interest with the emergence of ChatGPT.

item.title: Listen, Think, and Understand
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel audio foundation model, called LTU (Listen, Think, and Understand).

item.title: Universal Domain Adaptation from Foundation Models
item.description: We first demonstrate that, while foundation models greatly improve the performance of the baseline methods that train the models on the source data alone, existing UniDA methods generally fail to improve over the baseline.

item.title: X-IQE: eXplainable Image Quality Evaluation for Text-to-Image Generation with Visual Large Language Models
item.description: This paper introduces a novel explainable image quality evaluation approach called X-IQE, which leverages visual large language models (LLMs) to evaluate text-to-image generation methods by generating textual explanations.

item.title: Taxonomy Completion with Probabilistic Scorer via Box Embedding
item.description: Specifically, TaxBox consists of three components: (1) a graph aggregation module to leverage the structural information of the taxonomy and two lightweight decoders that map features to box embedding and capture complex relationships between concepts; (2) two probabilistic scorers that correspond to attachment and insertion operations and ensure the avoidance of pseudo-leaves; and (3) three learning objectives that assist the model in mapping concepts more granularly onto the box embedding space.

item.title: CLEME: Debiasing Multi-reference Evaluation for Grammatical Error Correction
item.description: Our proposed CLEME approach consistently and substantially outperforms existing reference-based GEC metrics on multiple reference sets in both corpus-level and sentence-level settings.

item.title: BioAug: Conditional Generation based Data Augmentation for Low-Resource Biomedical NER
item.description: Though data augmentation has shown to be highly effective for low-resource NER in general, existing data augmentation techniques fail to produce factual and diverse augmentations for BioNER.

item.title: Making More of Little Data: Improving Low-Resource Automatic Speech Recognition Using Data Augmentation
item.description: For Gronings, for which there was a pre-existing text-to-speech (TTS) system available, we also examined the use of TTS to generate ASR training data from text-only sources.

item.title: TAPIR: Learning Adaptive Revision for Incremental Natural Language Understanding with a Two-Pass Model
item.description: RNNs are fast but monotonic (cannot correct earlier output, which can be necessary in incremental processing).

item.title: Silver Syntax Pre-training for Cross-Domain Relation Extraction
item.description: One of the main reasons for this is the limited training size of current RE datasets: obtaining high-quality (manually annotated) data is extremely expensive and cannot realistically be repeated for each new domain.

item.title: DeepEdit: Deep Editable Learning for Interactive Segmentation of 3D Medical Images
item.description: Automatic segmentation of medical images is a key step for diagnostic and interventional tasks.

item.title: STREAMLINE: Streaming Active Learning for Realistic Multi-Distributional Settings
item.description: However, learning unbiased models depends on building a dataset that is representative of a diverse range of realistic scenarios for a given task.

item.title: Feature-Balanced Loss for Long-Tailed Visual Recognition
item.description: Deep neural networks frequently suffer from performance degradation when the training data is long-tailed because several majority classes dominate the training, resulting in a biased model.

item.title: StawGAN: Structural-Aware Generative Adversarial Networks for Infrared Image Translation
item.description: We test our model on aerial images of the DroneVeichle dataset containing RGB-IR paired images.

item.title: Unsupervised Pansharpening via Low-rank Diffusion Model
item.description: Specifically, we assume that the HRMS image is decomposed into the product of two low-rank tensors, i. e., the base tensor and the coefficient matrix.

item.title: Blackout Diffusion: Generative Diffusion Models in Discrete-State Spaces
item.description: Generalizing from specific (Gaussian) forward processes to discrete-state processes without a variational approximation sheds light on how to interpret diffusion models, which we discuss.

item.title: Ultra-High Resolution Segmentation with Ultra-Rich Context: A Novel Benchmark
item.description: With the increasing interest and rapid development of methods for Ultra-High Resolution (UHR) segmentation, a large-scale benchmark covering a wide range of scenes with full fine-grained dense annotations is urgently needed to facilitate the field.

item.title: Learning In-context Learning for Named Entity Recognition
item.description: M}$, and a new entity extractor can be implicitly constructed by applying new instruction and demonstrations to PLMs, i. e., $\mathcal{ (\lambda .

item.title: Multi-CrossRE A Multi-Lingual Multi-Domain Dataset for Relation Extraction
item.description: Most research in Relation Extraction (RE) involves the English language, mainly due to the lack of multi-lingual resources.

item.title: Contrastive State Augmentations for Reinforcement Learning-Based Recommender Systems
item.description: For the second issue, we propose introducing contrastive signals between augmented states and the state randomly sampled from other sessions to improve the state representation learning further.

item.title: Adaptive Graph Contrastive Learning for Recommendation
item.description: Two generators are able to create adaptive contrastive views, addressing the problem of model collapse and achieving adaptive contrastive learning.

item.title: Adjusting Logit in Gaussian Form for Long-Tailed Visual Recognition
item.description: Based on these perturbed features, two novel logit adjustment methods are proposed to improve model performance at a modest computational overhead.

item.title: LLMScore: Unveiling the Power of Large Language Models in Text-to-Image Synthesis Evaluation
item.description: Existing automatic evaluation on text-to-image synthesis can only provide an image-text matching score, without considering the object-level compositionality, which results in poor correlation with human judgments.

item.title: PPDONet: Deep Operator Networks for Fast Prediction of Steady-State Solutions in Disk-Planet Systems
item.description: We develop a tool, which we name Protoplanetary Disk Operator Network (PPDONet), that can predict the solution of disk-planet interactions in protoplanetary disks in real-time.

item.title: Attacks on Online Learners: a Teacher-Student Analysis
item.description: Machine learning models are famously vulnerable to adversarial attacks: small ad-hoc perturbations of the data that can catastrophically alter the model predictions.

item.title: Aligning Instruction Tasks Unlocks Large Language Models as Zero-Shot Relation Extractors
item.description: Recent work has shown that fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) on large-scale instruction-following datasets substantially improves their performance on a wide range of NLP tasks, especially in the zero-shot setting.

item.title: TEPrompt: Task Enlightenment Prompt Learning for Implicit Discourse Relation Recognition
item.description: Although an auxiliary task is not used to directly output final prediction, we argue that during the joint training some of its learned features can be useful to boost the main task.

item.title: TempAdaCos: Learning Temporally Structured Embeddings for Few-Shot Keyword Spotting with Dynamic Time Warping
item.description: Few-shot keyword spotting (KWS) systems often utilize a sliding window of fixed size.

item.title: TextDiffuser: Diffusion Models as Text Painters
item.description: Diffusion models have gained increasing attention for their impressive generation abilities but currently struggle with rendering accurate and coherent text.

item.title: Query Performance Prediction: From Ad-hoc to Conversational Search
item.description: The QPP task is to predict the retrieval quality of a search system for a query without relevance judgments.

item.title: Multilingual Event Extraction from Historical Newspaper Adverts
item.description: We find that: 1) even with scarce annotated data, it is possible to achieve surprisingly good results by formulating the problem as an extractive QA task and leveraging existing datasets and models for modern languages; and 2) cross-lingual low-resource learning for historical languages is highly challenging, and machine translation of the historical datasets to the considered target languages is, in practice, often the best-performing solution.

item.title: How does the task complexity of masked pretraining objectives affect downstream performance?
item.description: Masked language modeling (MLM) is a widely used self-supervised pretraining objective, where a model needs to predict an original token that is replaced with a mask given contexts.

item.title: Knowledge-based Integration of Multi-Omic Datasets with Anansi: Annotation-based Analysis of Specific Interactions
item.description: We further extend our framework beyond pairwise association testing to differential association testing, and show how anansi can be used to identify associations that differ in strength or degree based on sample covariates such as case/control status.

item.title: Discourse Centric Evaluation of Machine Translation with a Densely Annotated Parallel Corpus
item.description: Several recent papers claim human parity at sentence-level Machine Translation (MT), especially in high-resource languages.

item.title: A Survey on Time-Series Pre-Trained Models
item.description: Time-Series Mining (TSM) is an important research area since it shows great potential in practical applications.

item.title: MiraBest: A Dataset of Morphologically Classified Radio Galaxies for Machine Learning
item.description: Existing applications that utilise the MiraBest dataset are reviewed, and an extended dataset of 2100 sources is created by cross-matching MiraBest with other catalogues of radio-loud AGN that have been used more widely in the literature for machine learning applications.

item.title: Domain Adaptive Sim-to-Real Segmentation of Oropharyngeal Organs
item.description: In this work, we propose a domain adaptive Sim-to-Real framework called IoU-Ranking Blend-ArtFlow (IRB-AF) for image segmentation of oropharyngeal organs.

item.title: Paxion: Patching Action Knowledge in Video-Language Foundation Models
item.description: The Paxion framework utilizes a Knowledge Patcher network to encode new action knowledge and a Knowledge Fuser component to integrate the Patcher into frozen VidLMs without compromising their existing capabilities.

item.title: Self-supervised Fine-tuning for Improved Content Representations by Speaker-invariant Clustering
item.description: Self-supervised speech representation models have succeeded in various tasks, but improving them for content-related problems using unlabeled data is challenging.

item.title: Going Denser with Open-Vocabulary Part Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a detector with the ability to predict both open-vocabulary objects and their part segmentation.
